definition: to gather/to rake together/to pile up

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
to gather together/to collect/to approach/to draw near to/to add/to sum up/to comb (hair)

sentences.english: The author draws the different strands of the plot together in the final chapter.
sentences.chinese: 作者在最后一章把不同的情节线索归拢到了一起。

sentences.english: The seamstress gathered in the cloth.
Thank you for humoring me while I put my house back together again.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢您迁就我当我把房间重新归拢到一起。
把一切都归拢起来似乎是不可能的。

definition: to draw to oneself/to gather up/to collect/to fold up (an umbrella, wings etc)/to assemble (a party of persons)/to rope in (some people)
to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
to rummage/to look through/to leaf through
to browse and select/to glance through and check
erhua variant of 一股腦|一股脑[yi1 gu3 nao3]
to gather (people)/to collect (talent)/to come to an end
